thread.title: With backs to wall, Eagles win by 2
thread.title_full: With backs to wall, Eagles win by 2

author: ANDY ROBERTSON
title: With backs to wall, Eagles win by 2
text:
With backs to wall, Eagles win by 2   9:25pm By ANDY ROBERTSON LOG CABIN STAFF WRITER 
VILONIA — The Vilonia Eagles (4-4, 2-3 5A-West) snapped their three-game losing streak with a 22-20 win over the Farmington Cardinals (3-5, 1-3 5A-West). 
“We dug ourselves a hole as far as playoffs and our backs are against the wall,” Vilonia coach Michael Stout said. “That was a very good Farmington team and they’re fighting for a playoff spot as well.” 
The win keeps Vilonia’s playoff hopes alive with two games left. 
The winning touchdown came on a 38-yard pass down the Vilonia sideline from Eagle quarterback Luke Gordon to Blaine Norman, bringing the score to 22-20 with 2:49 left in the third quarter. 
The touchdown came after Farmington quarterback Brice Waggle completed a 26-yard touchdown pass in the corner of the end zone to tight end Nick Hugg, giving the Cardinals a 20-15 lead with 4:15 left in the third. 
A bobbled snap caused Farmington to try for a two-point conversion, but Vilonia defenders stopped the conversion in the backfield, leaving the score at 20-15. 
After several failed opportunities to score at the beginning of the game, the Cardinals finally got on the board in the closing seconds of the first quarter on a 4-yard rushing touchdown by running back Justice Hobbs. The 2-point conversion, brought the score to 8-0 with 16.3 seconds left in the first quarter. 
The Eagles came back and put together an 11 play, 58-yard drive that was capped off by an 8-yard quarterback keeper by Gordon for a touchdown. 
The extra point made it 8-7 in favor of the Cardinals. 
Neither team could get anything going for much of the second quarter until Vilonia put together an eight-play drive that focused primarily on Gordon and his ability to pass and run the ball. He threw a 4-yard touchdown pass to wide receiver Tripp Reed with 1:50 left on the clock, giving the Eagles their first lead of the game. 
Running back Cody Mitchell followed up the touchdown pass with a TWO-point conversion, bringing the score to 15-8. 
An 82-yard return by Farmington wide receiver Trenton McChristian on the ensuing kickoff allowed the Cardinals to start their drive at the Vilonia 8. 
The Eagles defense stepped up in a big way and stopped Farmington from scoring on a halfback pass, ending the first half. 
In the third quarter, the Cardinals fought back with a 6-yard rushing touchdown by Hobbs, bringing Farmington within one after a failed two-point conversion. 
The scoring concluded in the third quarter with the 38-yard pass from Gordon to Norman. 
Waggle was intercepted a three times late in the game, making it four interceptions on the night. 
One of the interceptions was thrown in the end zone, where Norman r1eturned the pick 28 yards. 
It was the first of two interceptions for Norman and cornerback Gage Johnston also had two interceptions. 
“We won by two points, so anytime we get interceptions is big, and hopefully, offensively we can capitalize on it,” Stout said. 
Vilonia travels to Harrison on Friday to play the Golden Goblins with playoff hopes hanging in the balance.
